attributes.action: Implement compulsory conscription for young people (over 16) who are persistent petty criminals or who continue to 'sign on' for long periods.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To try to get teenage 'gang culture' under control by conscripting youths into the army if, once they leave education, actively refuse to contribute(work),or who purposefully and repeatedly look to disrupt society through anti-social behaviour,petty crime,vandalism,violence or intimidation etc).

This tactic could:

*Reduce the need for places in prisons,
*Give the young person a more formidable deterent for repeated anti-social behaviour,
*Give the young person purpose and make them give something back,
*Reduce the vast amounts of time and money which is pointlessly plowed into'rehabilitating' 'disadvantaged' young people,
*Protect the public from repeat offenders by getting them off of the streets,
*Reduce the amount of people endlessly 'signing on'(especially straight out of school),
*Teach the young person discipline, self control and self respect,
*Make them take responsibility for their lives rather than persistently living off of Government handouts and/or the proceeds of crime,
*Make young people more likely to seek work and/or stay in school(this would be a likely outcome if they knew that the army was their only other option).

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
